name: KeithTeachesPython
tagline: A Workshop by UMass ACM Cybersecurity Club 02/18/2016
body: ### Welcome to Keith Teaches Python This is an introductory overview of Python, but what is Python? Python refers to "CPython" which is a version of the Python interpreter built in C. Some other implementations include Jython which is built in Java and IronPython which is built in C#. Also, there is in fact a difference between certain versions of Python. Python3 and Python2 have some key differences in how they were built. Today, when I say Python, I mean Python2 (most specifically CPython2.7.X) not Python3. Python3 is much newer, but Python2 is still dominant. ## Pre-Workshop Setup We will be going over key features of using Python for scientific computing using the Anaconda Python distribution. Please **download and install Python2.7**: Anaconda Downloads ### Authors and Contributors Keith Miller (@keithemiller) ### Support or Contact Need help? Something broken? Shoot me an email at keithmiller@umass.edu
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
